author: smartprogrammer
content: <@808969530608451584> Can we get gethLike traces from both reth and geth for 1736

author: smartprogrammer
content: Nethermind is consistent with Reth on this block so we want to know which client/s is forking off spec

author: pk910
content:
most reth & geth pairs seem to be at  `0xaa761d58f02dacede027a9f3439196328978bb7987b0af4cfe19f1df45b0aabb` at block height 1736 right now, which doesn't contain any transaction.

I've actually only found 1 reth node that's on another block at that height:
lodestar-reth-1: `0xb9b84eed535f90adacc9e3ad559d1fa5a1abe7f80908bbd5d1ee446de627646e` 

I can give a trace of that block in reth,   but don't have anything to compare it against?

author: pk910
content: do you have a hash of the block you're interested in?  can try `debug_traceBlockByHash` on the nodes

author: smartprogrammer
content: We are pulling the traces from nethermind which should be similar to the reth one

author: smartprogrammer
content: do you know the timesamp of the geth block at 1736

author: pk910
content:
Here's the trace for 1736 from lodestar-reth-1 (`0xb9b84eed535f90adacc9e3ad559d1fa5a1abe7f80908bbd5d1ee446de627646e`).
It's the only block at height 1736 that contains a transaction.
The other 4 blocks from other pairs at height 1736 are empty

author: pk910

author: tbenr

author: parithosh
content:
How do people feel about us launching devnet-2 ahead of time, like tomorrow?

devnet-1 is pretty cooked, there are too many issues to realistically triage them. We know there are some 7702 related issues that have been fixed now. We also were missing archive nodes and a tracing tool we'd like to run at genesis next time. 

I'd propose devnet-2 to have the same spec and features as devnet-1, launch set for tomorrow to create a cleaner testing env. Link to spec: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/pectra-devnet-1

any thoughts? comments? objections?

author: nordbjerg
content: so essentially a reboot of devnet-1? we'd be ok with that from reth side

author: parithosh
content: exactly, number bump is to just keep things clean

author: tersec
content: Nimbus isn't the main affected project here -- the devnet-1 discussions appeared to be quite EL-centric -- but sure, why not

author: smartprogrammer
content: we are good with that

author: daniellehrner
content: From Besu side: While fixing the bug that Ahmad pointed out I found another one for 7702 txs and fixing that one currently. I guess by tomorrow we should be ready for a reboot.

author: lightclient
content: fine by me - but can we not trigger 7702 in the next devnet? since the spec has changed, it doesn't really add much value to seriously test the previous version

author: parithosh
content: Would you prefer we wait and update 7702 implimentations before relaunch? or relaunch as is and avoid 7702?

author: lightclient
content: probably should just relaunch and avoid triggering 7702 as much as possible

author: parithosh
content: sounds good. will plan it in for tomorrow then

author: _shemnon
content: There is an EIP standard trace - https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3155 - all clients should produce that.  It also makes trace fuzzing easier.

author: daniellehrner
content: I've fixed the bugs in Besu wrt 7702 and the PR is already merged. So we are ready to join devnet-2 as well.

author: parithosh
content: same branch?

author: daniellehrner
content: Yes, it's on `main`

author: smartprogrammer
content: Would love to see the other bug, nethermind ended up agreeing with besu on the last devnet, so maybe we still have that bug

author: marioevz
content: Us too, to produce a test
